intro: Mionandra camareoides, commonly known as the rock fig, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often glossy and elliptical in shape. It produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers followed by edible, fleshy fruits. Mionandra camareoides is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
